projects.description: An app that displays random famous quotes in intervals and when a button is clicked. Features include random background and button colors upon each change as well as 30 second intervals.

A tool to enhance the usability of a webpage that displays too much information. This tool adheres to the principle of progressive enhancement, so even without JavaScript, this page's information is still available. The code in this application limits list items to 10, and will dynamically update the page range depending on the results available from search criteria.

An enhancement of a registration form by adding custom interactivity using conditional behavior and client-side user input validation. In this form, the JavaScript provides real time form validation as the user inputs email and credit card number. When "other" is selected from the job role, a new field will be displayed allowing the user to add a custom job role. Additionally, the T-shirt feild and activity feild are both restricted based on choices by the user. You can only chose T-shirt colors based on T-shirt designs and you cannot select overlapping activities. Finally, the form will not allow the user to submit information, unless all applicable fields are verified. If the user fails to input valid information, form validation errors will be present after attempting to submit the form.

A functional two player Tic-Tac-Toe game including an unbeatable single player option. This game will allow you to enter the players' names before starting. Subsequently, the game will display the winner when someone has satisfied the win condition of getting 3 icons in a row, or display the "Tie" screen when there is no winner. This game utilizes the minimax algorithm in order to create an unbeatable single player option. When challenging the computer, there is no chance of victory.

An app to help remote employees share contact information with their coworkers. In this app, 12 random profiles are requested via AJAX from the Random User Generator API and are returned as a JSON object. Additional features include, the search box to filter profiles and the ability to access additional information on each profile by clicking on the profile to open a modal window. Each modal window allows the user to page through each profile until the beginning or ending of the list is reached.
